revised_title: Neural Monitoring of Visual Stimuli and Frontal Cortex Impairment
tldr: This study investigates the impact of lesions in the middle sector of the dorsolateral frontal cortex on non-human primates' ability to recall their choices of visual stimuli. The results show that these lesions cause a significant impairment in recall without affecting the recognition of the stimuli. The findings highlight the critical role of the mid-dorsolateral frontal cortex in monitoring self-generated responses.
